intro: Consolida incana, commonly known as the common honesty, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, papery petals and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. It typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters and prefers well-drained soil in full sun. Its seed pods, which split open to reveal bright red seeds, are a distinctive feature of the plant.
